title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 March 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:00 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
00:34 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:47 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r48a2f9c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/48a2f9c0b01cb6a13f88b5c3459bda9b43660533 / (6 files in 3 dirs): XE-1140: Use PNG silk icons instead of GIF ...  
03:12 <DrLou> has quit  
04:12 <faryshta> has quit  
04:18 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
04:57 <sdumitriu> has quit  
05:00 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
05:22 <qwebirc62554> has joined #xwiki  
05:23 <qwebirc62554> has left #xwiki  
06:59 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <Denis> has quit  
07:38 <cjd> has quit  
07:49 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
07:52 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <sdumitriu> has quit  
08:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:03 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rb18d3be https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b18d3bee5f510c16445a5dc083f1fced7e535c23 / (11 files in 6 dirs): XWIKI-7655: Use PNG silk icons instead of GIF ...  
09:08 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning, could you give your opinion on removing deprecated apis in 2.x  
09:08 <vmassol> ?  
09:08 <+mflorea> just replied a second ago  
09:08 <+mflorea> I'm big +1  
09:08 <vmassol> I have removed all the deprecated apis in the bridge (they were deprecated in 2.2) and would like to commit  
09:08 <vmassol> ok great  
09:09 <vmassol> sburjan: good morning  
09:10 <+sburjan> good morning vmassol  
09:10 <vmassol> sburjan: Eddy has committed lots of stuff yesterday (I need to check but I think he merged his commit on master). We're gong to need a test session to verify the 3 things he hadded  
09:10 <vmassol> s/hadded/added/  
09:10 <vmassol> - comment/anno merge  
09:10 <vmassol> - extensible user profile  
09:10 <vmassol> - extensible user dir  
09:10 <+sburjan> yes, I will test it. waiting for some documentation to be online  
09:11 <vmassol> since we need to release tomorrow not sure we should wait for that ;)  
09:11 <vmassol> I'll try to test a bit myself too  
09:11 <+sburjan> how can I test without knowing the expected behavior ?  
09:11 <vmassol> you read the jira issues  
09:12 <vmassol> XWIKI-7540: Merge Annotations with Comments.  
09:12 <vmassol> XWIKI-7626: Allow customization of the user profile  
09:13 <vmassol> XE-1131: Allow users to customize their view of the user directory  
09:14 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r4b0007e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/4b0007e478942d4a0a5fff0b36df7ca25f766027 / (19 files in 9 dirs): [Misc] Remove old deprecations from the Bridge module - http://git.io/Zhi\_cw  
09:14 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r7c7b98c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/7c7b98ce747605a28ebba37248d937e6ea689f84 / xwiki-enterprise-web/pom.xml : [Misc] Remove old deprecations from the Bridge module - http://git.io/jp5HOw  
09:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <+sburjan> vmassol: I think I'll start with testing the annotations migration  
10:08 <vmassol> ok  
10:10 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <+sburjan> too bad you can't see the annotations/comments thread in their location, and you have to go to bottom  
10:21 <vmassol> errr?  
10:21 <vmassol> you can  
10:21 <vmassol> this hasn't changed AFAIK  
10:21 <+sburjan> also clicking on "reply" from the annotation box doesn't trigger any text area, instead the cursor is moved at the bottom of the page  
10:22 <+sburjan> you can see annotations, but no the thread, only the first annotation. exactly like before  
10:22 <vmassol> yep o  
10:22 <vmassol> k  
10:22 <+sburjan> I don't like that  
10:24 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <+sburjan> almost defeats the purpose of threaded annotations  
10:26 <+sburjan> also deleting the initial annotations, will not delete the whole thread. Is this normal ?  
10:27 <vmassol> there's nothing "normal", you should send a mail on the list with all your findings and suggestions and ask people to give their opinions  
10:28 <+sburjan> this is why I don't like to test when I don't know the behaviour, because I never know if it's intended or not  
10:29 <vmassol> it doesn't matter  
10:29 <vmassol> if it's intended or not  
10:29 <vmassol> the fact that you don't find it good is enough for you to justify proposing something better  
10:30 <vmassol> said differently  
10:30 <vmassol> it's not because something is intended but behaving a in bad manner that we shouldn't improve it :)  
10:31 <vmassol> I would even argue  
10:31 <vmassol> that it's best if you don't know what's intended  
10:32 <vmassol> since it won't skew your judgement!  
10:32 <vmassol> ;)  
10:33 <+sburjan> well maybe Eduard had good reasons for doing it like this, or maybe he didn't had the end-user perspecitve (which I am having always when testing something new).. so maybe a vote on the list with what I don't like could help us shape the intended behavior  
10:34 <vmassol> have confidence in you sburjan  
10:34 <vmassol> if it happens you were wrong and someone tells you after you've proposed an improvement so bet it, you'll just have learnt something and you'll progress  
10:34 <vmassol> s/bet/be/  
10:35 <vmassol> don't do a vote  
10:35 <vmassol> just send a list of ideas for further improvements  
10:35 <+sburjan> yepp... I never send a vote until I personally talk with other 3 people and they agree too :)  
10:36 <+sburjan> I'll send a list of what I have found from a end user perspective, and everybody can state their opinions  
10:36 <vmassol> well you can't really send a vote  
10:36 <+sburjan> yes, because I am not a committer  
10:36 <vmassol> wait forget that  
10:36 <vmassol> right  
10:37 <vmassol> but you can send ideas/suggestions/etc  
10:37 <vmassol> which is the same  
10:37 <vmassol> bbiab  
10:37 <+sburjan> thanks for the suggesteions, I will send a list of ideas/suggestions, and see what the community thinks  
10:56 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <faryshta> evalica, hi.  
11:50 <faryshta> I want to send my GSoC application but I would like you to see it first and tell me if I miss something.  
11:50 <+evalica> well you should post in in melange  
11:50 <+evalica> mentors can comment there  
11:50 <+evalica> until the deadline you can make adjustments there  
11:50 <faryshta> evalica, I sent it to the devs mail list and you gave it  look with a few comments. Would like if you do it once more.  
11:51 <faryshta> evalica, ohh which is the melange page?  
11:51 <+evalica> http://www.google-melange.com/gsoc/org/google/gsoc2012/xwiki  
11:53 <faryshta> evalica, thanks.  
11:54 <+evalica> np faryshta  
11:57 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r933f606 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/933f6068c78f0428cb7a914c22aaf0745f651486 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-extension/xwiki-commons-extension-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/internal/safe/AbstractSafeObject.java : Fix @since tag and javadoc - http://git.io/2c5teg  
11:57 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* rf2a606a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/f2a606ab171182d8ece5482289c97f50f462b937 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-extension/xwiki-commons-extension-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/internal/safe/AbstractSafeObject.java : XCOMMONS-136: Introduce live question/answer system for jobs ...  
12:04 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* rda24c66 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/da24c6624fd4a5219bb2ccb02e04729c70a3702b / (20 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7647: User new Job question/answer system to ask user to resolve merge conflicts in installed XARs ...
